channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024100889
item.description:
Report X-2024100889

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-13
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release during sort operations at the MEMH location. It contained glass bottles in bubble wrap bags and bubble wrap for dunnage. One of the bottles broke spill the contents in the fiberboard box. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement. 4. X-2024100888 A fiberboard box with signs of a release discovered during sort operations at the MEMH location. item.title: Report X-2024100801
item.description:
Report X-2024100801

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-12
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered at the MEMH location. Inside of the fiberboard box was a smaller fiberboard box with twelve cans of spray paint. One of the cans looked to have a damaged bottom chime causing the release. Contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024100800
item.description:
Report X-2024100800

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-12
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was dropped during the unloading process. The fiberboard box contained a single metal can with positive closure tabs but the fall bent the top chime causing the lid to open. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024100481
item.description:
Report E-2024100481

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 10, 2024, one (1) can of lithium was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) tablespoon of product to the box containing it. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel placed the damaged container of product into one (1) 5-gallon bucket and staged it on the trailer to be taken back to the terminal as product.

item.title: Report E-2024100479
item.description:
Report E-2024100479

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: PIONEER
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 9, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3264 had a loose cap during transit and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized soda ash, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024100480
item.description:
Report E-2024100480

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 9, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizing agent and absorbents to remediate the site. The damaged pail and all impacted absorbents were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024100884
item.description:
Report X-2024100884

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was dropped during the loading process. The fiberboard box contained four glass bottles packaged with styrofoam holders top and bottom and packaged in plastic bags. One of the glass bottles broke spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
